001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Decorator;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.activations.ActivationFunction;
005
006import java.util.List;
007
008/**
009 * A specialized {@link Neuron} that remembers the input values
010 * from its most recent activation.
011 * <p>
012 * This class extends the basic neuron by capturing and storing the
013 * raw outputs of its input neurons during the forward pass. The stored
014 * inputs do not affect the computation of the neuron’s output but
015 * provide additional visibility or state for downstream processing,
016 * such as training algorithms, debugging, or interpretability tools.
017 * </p>
018 *
019 * <h2>Behavior</h2>
020 * <ul>
021 *   <li>On {@link #activate()}, performs the standard neuron computation
022 *       (weighted sum + bias → activation function) and also stores a copy
023 *       of the input values provided by connected neurons.</li>
024 *   <li>The stored inputs can be retrieved via {@link #getStoredInput(int)}.</li>
025 * </ul>
026 */
027@Decorator
028public class LastInputStoredNeuron extends Neuron {
029
030    private final float[] storedInputs;
031
032    /**
033     * Constructs a neuron that stores the inputs from its most recent activation.
034     *
035     * @param name               human-readable identifier
036     * @param inputs             input neurons feeding into this neuron
037     * @param activationFunction activation function to apply after weighted sum
038     */
039    public LastInputStoredNeuron(String name, List<? extends Neuron> inputs, ActivationFunction activationFunction) {
040        super(name, inputs, activationFunction);
041        storedInputs = new float[inputs == null ? 0 : inputs.size()];
042    }
043
044    /**
045     * Activates this neuron by performing the normal weighted sum
046     * and activation function, and additionally storing the raw input
047     * values from connected neurons.
048     */
049    public synchronized void activate() {
050        super.activate();
051        for (int i = 0; i < getInputNodes().size(); i++) {
052            storedInputs[i] = getInputNodes().get(i).getOutput();
053        }
054    }
055
056    /**
057     * Returns the input value that was stored for a specific dimension during the
058     * most recent {@link #activate()} call.
059     * <p>
060     * Dimension indexing is 1-based, where {@code d = 1} refers to the first
061     * input neuron, {@code d = 2} to the second, and so on.
062     *
063     * @param d the input dimension index (1-based)
064     * @return the stored input value for the specified dimension
065     */
066    public float getStoredInput(int d) {
067        return storedInputs[validDimension(d) - 1];
068    }
069
070}
